main event: A bright light that grew orange in color and appeared brighter than a normal star was observed hovering and moving in the sky over Rego Park, New York on a clear night in June 1968.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a half dollar when viewed through binoculars and resembled a miniature ship with glowing edges.
The object would disappear for a short time and then reappear, moving in various directions over the neighborhood.
The sighting lasted for approximately 5-10 minutes.
No sound, odor, heat or other effects were noticed from the object.
The observer had not seen anything like this phenomenon before.
sighted object: a bright, orange light that appeared brighter than a star
